Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Reflux \Re"flux`\ (r?"fl?ks`), a. Returning, or flowing back; reflex; as, reflux action. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Reflux \Re"flux`\, n. [F. reflux. See {Refluent}, {Flux}.] A flowing back, as the return of a fluid; ebb; reaction; as, the flux and reflux of the tides. [1913 Webster]
All from me Shall with a fierce reflux on me redound. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
reflux n 1: an abnormal backward flow of body fluids 2: the outward flow of the tide [syn: {ebb}]
